TextView.android:text: Sheet H: TItle Block - All-Stop Procedure
The All-Stop Procedure may only be used to
stop traffic for a brief period (typically 2 mins
but not exceeding 10 mins) during works on or
near a road. It must NOT be used as a
substitute for other forms of traffic control,
and should ONLY be used at low risk sites.
Is the stoppage within ALL STOP time limits?
Are there at least 2no. operatives on site?
Is there good visibility for minimum 60m?
Including weather, and obstructions to view,
Is the works vehicle parked safely, and not
obstructing visibility?
Is it a period of low risk?
i.e. off-peak, Extremely low traffic and
pedestrian Vol etc.
Are all operatives wearing Class III high
visibility clothing?
Are the works taking place in Minor Traffic?
(less than 20 vehicles passing in 3 minutes)
Is there no more than one moving vehicle
within 100m of the site?
Is the "STOP" sign double sided reflective,
mounted on a black/yellow pole?
Is Quick Reinstatement of the site possible?
Can the crew immediately return the site to
it's original condition and walk off the site if a
vehicle approaches?
Use Sheet 0 to select appropriate
traffic management plan, or refer
to your inspector.
Complete the works in a safe manner:
1. One operative with "STOP" Board to deal
solely with traffic.
2. Wait until road is Clear, move into position.
3. Show "STOP" Board to oncoming traffic,
Keeping watch at all times.
4. If works will take longer than 2 min, move
off road and complete with the correct
Traffic Plan.
